intro: Telanthera pungens, commonly known as the stinging leaf or stinging plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from white to pink in color. The plant is known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation and is responsible for its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
